Class.name: ompare.SourceHandler.Namespace
Class.Description:

Source: https://github.com/alexatwoodhead/ompare
Version: 1.0
Capture product deployment metadata context about the Namespace being analysed. These minimum contexts will make it simpler to report configuration for comparing accross environments. The following diagram shows the relationship of deployment concepts:
  1. Organisation - (eg: ACME and MEEP)
  2. System - (eg: PlanA and PlanB)
  3. Environment - (eg: BASE, TEST, UAT, PROD)
In the example code is developed for two customers on a single shared inhouse development instance. Each customer provides 3 seperate instances to support TEST, UAT and PROD stages. The cylinders represent namespaces. In the example each logical product deployment consists of two participating namespaces. Components for PlanA (System) occupy one namespace and components PlanB (System) occupy the other.
Metadata is added to each target namespace for next and subsequent analysis. Update the lookup global using Interoperability LookupTables or Global Explorer in SMP or directly. When first run in each namespace the following blank defaults will be added if no previous setting is detected. ^Ens.LookupTable("ompare.Namespace","Organisation")="" ^Ens.LookupTable("ompare.Namespace","System")="" ^Ens.LookupTable("ompare.Namespace","Environment")="" A complete configuration would be: ^Ens.LookupTable("ompare.Namespace","Organisation")="MEEP" ^Ens.LookupTable("ompare.Namespace","System")="PlanA" ^Ens.LookupTable("ompare.Namespace","Environment")="TEST"

Parameter.name: TypeCode
Parameter.Description: Ensure this Code doesn't collide with other sub-class implementations of Base Eg: "CLS" abbreviation for class

Method.name: IndexNamespace
Method.Description: Do not invoke supporting methods on this class definition
